item.title: 'Tough day for us at Twitter': Tech giant investigates 'social engineering attack'
description: Twitter is investigating after hackers targeted several high-profile US figures in a "co-ordinated social engineering attack".
(L-R) Barack Obama, Jeff Bezos, Kim Kardashian

item.title: Oxford's coronavirus vaccine 'could provide double protection'
description: Researchers at the University of Oxford believe they have made a breakthrough in the development of a coronavirus vaccine.
A Oxford University scientist with some of the vaccine doses

item.title: Amazon issues urgent 'overheating' warning about Echo Buds earphones
description: Amazon has issued an urgent warning over its Echo Buds earphones, saying there is risk they could overheat while being charged.
Amazon has issued a fire warning about its Echo Buds earphones

item.title: Revealed: The 'Starlink Router' set to power SpaceX's satellite-based broadband
description: Plans for the WiFi router used by SpaceX's satellite-based broadband business Starlink have been revealed in a regulatory filing.
The router for SpaceX's satellite broadband project has been revealed. Pic: FCC

item.title: Trust 'seriously damaged' between UK and China over Huawei ban
description: Serious damage has been done to the UK's relationship with China and investment could suffer following the government's decision to dump Huawei, Beijing's man in London has said.
Boris Johnson and Xi Jinping have spoken on the phone

item.title: Record methane levels found in atmosphere (and burping cows are major contributor)
description: Burping cows are a massive contributor to emissions of the potent greenhouse gas methane, which has reached record levels according to new research.

MACCLESFIELD, UNITED KINGDOM - MAY 03: A Pedigree Aberdeen Angus is seen on Pyegreave Farm, Langley, Cheshire, on May 3rd, 2006, Macclesfield Cheshire, England. The pedigree cattle on the farm are bred to help rejuvenate UK beef stock as Beef farmers welcome the decision by the EU to lift the 10 year ban on British beef exports. Live cattle born after 1 August 1996 can now be exported, as can beef from cattle slaughtered after 15 June, 2005. (Photo by Christopher Furlong/Getty Images)

item.title: Apple and Ireland win appeal over EU's €13bn tax demand
description: Apple and Ireland have won an appeal against an EU order that the tech giant pay the country €13bn (£11.6bn) in back taxes.
The European Commission has labelled Apple's operations in Ireland a "sham"

item.title: Tech entrepreneur 'found dismembered' in luxury New York City apartment
description: A tech entrepreneur has been found dismembered in his luxury New York City apartment, according to reports.
The apartment complex at 265 Houston Street, where Fahim Saleh, Co-founder/CEO of Gokada, was found dead is seen in New York City, New York, U.S., July 15, 2020. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton

item.title: Sony 'to double PS5 production to meet demand due to pandemic'
description: Sony is reportedly boosting production of the upcoming PlayStation 5 console with an expectation that home entertainment demand will be higher due to the coronavirus pandemic.
PlayStation 5. Pic: Sony

item.title: Pictured: Skin rash which is 'fourth symptom of COVID-19'
description: A skin rash can sometimes be the only symptom of people infected with COVID-19, a study has concluded.
A hive-type rash, or urticaria, is among the three skin conditions that can be the only symptom of COVID-19. Pic: James Heilman
